column4: I'm setting up a softraid array. Two discs, raid1 - and I'm leaving a little free space for a future possible windows install. My question - should I lump everything into the array, or have a separate 16gb raid0 array for my swap?
Or even just whack the swap on a single disc?
no need to make an raid0 array for swap. if two swaps have the same prio in fstab the kernel with stripp automatically between the two
no you can raid two paritions
